intro: Campium modestum, commonly known as the common tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite flower heads, which are typical of the daisy family. Campium modestum is often found in dry meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. It has a long flowering period, typically from late spring to early autumn.
